page.title: 06College Farm
page.content: Fronlas farm is worked in the {traditional Hafod-Hendre {way;i.e.animals kept on the {uplands in Summer&at home in Winter. 200 students attend to learn about mixed farming.Most of the modern farming machines in use can be found on the farm.There are mobile classrooms in the farm-yard,where students attend lectures.The friesian dairy herd is fed largely on home produced silage. The farm is very popular with school children.Groups visit Fronlas and are shown round;lambing time is especially popular. Part of the farm is fenced off to {make a very interesting nature trail. Local schools make good use of this. Great care is taken in the use of chemicals so that wild life is not harmed.
